peopleAlsoAsk.question: How much does it cost to get art appraised?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Art appraisers may adjust their hourly rate depending on the scope of the appraisal assignment, but on average you should expect to pay between $150-$500 per hour for a USPAP-compliant art appraisal.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How much does it cost to get art appraised?

peopleAlsoAsk.question: Is it legal to own Pre-Columbian art?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: It is against the law of the United States to bring most pre-Columbian art into this country. Maya pottery from the Peten area is especially illegal. When tempted to buy antiquities in Central America all kinds of tall tales will be given to encourage you to buy.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Notice on Antiquities Laws relative to Maya Art.

peopleAlsoAsk.question: Who buys pre-Columbian artifacts?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Over the past 15 years, Sotheby's auctions of Pre-Columbian art have realised nearly $45 million and we continue to lead the field.
